title.narrative: HEALTH SYSTEM STRENGTHENING, POLICIES, STRATEGIES AND PLANS

description.narrative: Health Systems Strengthened to efficiently and effectively deliver quality services, focusing in the most deprived and emergency- prone geographic areas, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Child Health, Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Early Childhood Development, Hiv Prevention, Immunization, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Micronutrients, Nutrition And Emergencies, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2019, the most vulnerable children, boys, girls, adolescents and women of child bearing age will have reduced reported common preventable illnesses and disease conditions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Health Systems Strengthened to efficiently and effectively deliver quality services, focusing in the most deprived and emergency- prone geographic areas

description.narrative: The capture of sexual and reproductive health information and the integration of community health data was integrated into the DHIS2 platform to enable programme monitoring for action; the platform rolled out in two provinces. Advocacy was pursued with the Ministry of Health to strengthen Sector coordination, health systems vision and plan development. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:17/01/2020

title.narrative: Availability of a Nutrition Strategic Plan(36909)

actual.value: 2019:National Nutrition Policy and National Nutrition Strategic Plan 2019-2022 developed in 2018. Both documents were technically validated and submitted for signature by line Ministries.
